title: Dog Breeds: Artificial Selection
description: A short lesson to help you apply Dog Breeds: Artificial Selection.

hook.text: A Chihuahua and a Great Dane are the same species. Humans created that difference in just 15,000 years.

buildup.text: Wolves that were less fearful of humans got food scraps. Over generations, they became dogs.

discovery.text: Humans then bred dogs for specific traits: herding, guarding, hunting, companionship.

punchline.text: From wolf to poodle in 15,000 years. That's the power of selective breeding.
